body.p: IASC acknowledged that an enterprise would use judgement in determining whether an impairment loss needed to be recognised. For this reason, IAS 36 included some safeguards to limit the risk that an enterprise may make an over‑optimistic (pessimistic) estimate of recoverable amount:

li.p: IAS 36 requires a formal estimate of recoverable amount whenever there is an indication that:
an asset may be impaired; or
an impairment loss may no longer exist or may have decreased.
For this purpose, IAS 36 includes a relatively detailed (although not exhaustive) list of indicators that an asset may be impaired (see paragraphs 12 and 111 of IAS 36).
IAS 36 provides guidelines for the basis of management’s projections of future cash flows to be used to estimate value in use (see paragraph 33 of IAS 36).
